TopicTitle: RT2 drives me nuts. Not relaying correctly?!

Articles.Content:
Hello

I have a set of probes in Keostationary Orbit.

  • 2 Reflectron KR-7 90Mm Dishes
  • 2 Communotron 16 2.50Mm Omni Directional Antennas

All probes have Power. All Dishes are set to Mission Control / Active Vessel. All Omni Antennas are deployed.

Now the following happens (follow mentioned satellites counter clockwise, so COM.T1 #2 is left from COM.T1 #3, etc.):

First image shows COM.T1 #3 having an active relay to COM.T1 #2 and is within 2.5Mm range. Dish 1 is pointed to Mission Control. Dish 2 to Active Vessel.

The Satellite has NO connection:

Next image shows COM.T1 #2 with the exact same setup. COM.T1 #2 has an active relay to COM.T1 #1 and is within 2.5Mm range. Dish 1 is pointed to Mission Control. Dish 2 to Active Vessel.

This Satellite HAS connection:

Last image shows COM.T1 #3 again. This time with forced connection to COM.T1 #1.

Now this Satellite HAS connection aswell:

But why is it only working in this setup? Isn't Sat#1 meant to relay to Sat#2, Sat#2 to Sat#3 and so on?

I really don't get it why this isn't working?!
If you force a connection from #2 to #1 (you'd have to have dishes point at each other), is the connection active? I've never tried to use omnis for relaying, only for the last leg of the connection.

He is out of range for the Communotron 16 and his problem is he's using Active Vessel which, I think people think it relay's through all the sat's and it don't it just hit's 1 target and that the Active 1 .

Oh, of course you're right, for some reason I read the range as 4.5Mm instead of 2.5.

Scratch that, no he's not, #3 is 2.4Mm away from #2 which is 2.4Mm from #1, they should be relaying.

Edited September 18, 2014 by StarkRG

Of course, using omnis in this way is rather silly since you'd need many more satellites than you would just using dishes. With dishes you just need 3 satellites and they don't need one dedicated to KSC, just point them at Kerbin and you'll pick up both KSC and Communotron omnis. The DTS-M1 is nice in that it gives you a 45 degree angle when pointed at Kerbin, this is enough to get most low-kerbin and medium-kerbin orbits (above a certain height you'll get drop-outs as you pass out of the angle).

Edited September 18, 2014 by StarkRG

Ok, I got it. Thanks guys.

1 DTS-M1 (pointing to Active Vessel) and 1 Communotron is enough. Just did some tests. But since I don't have the Communotron 32 yet (with 5.0 Mm range) I need to setup an (temporary) array in a lower Orbit I guess, otherwise the C16 can't relay to KSC.
